intro: Micromeria graeca var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf micromeria, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and aromatic foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
